intro: Pyrenacantha cordicula, commonly known as the heart-shaped thornapple, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are followed by orange-red, berry-like fruits. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
